title: Late Asia Session
commentary: Crypto steadied in late Asian trading with Bitcoin hovering at $67,149 (+0.4%) and Ethereum reclaiming $1,971 (+1.3%) after the earlier session dip. Gold's pullback below $5,000 is being viewed as corrective rather than structural — WSJ notes dips are likely to attract renewed buying interest as geopolitical hedging demand persists. Crude oil remains volatile as geopolitics clash with oversupply fears; Vance's military-action warning on Iran kept a bid under WTI even as U.S. natural gas slid below $3 on mild weather. The "sell everything American" call from a 40-year Wall Street veteran continues to reverberate, adding to the cautious tone heading into Wednesday's full session.

title: Asia Evening Wrap
commentary: Gold retreated below the $5,000 mark as progress in U.S.-Iran nuclear talks eased geopolitical premiums, while crude oil pushed higher on VP Vance's warning that military action remains on the table. S&P 500 and Nasdaq edged up in Monday's Presidents' Day-shortened session as the Dow finished flat — a 40-year Wall Street veteran making headlines urging clients to dump U.S. assets entirely. Bitcoin slipped 1.3% to $67,189 and Ethereum shed 1.0% to $1,969 as risk appetite faded into the holiday week. The dollar firmed on the Iran détente narrative, pressuring precious metals further with silver also declining.

title: Valentine's Day Early SGT
commentary: Crypto continues its Valentine's weekend tear — ETH +6.8% at $2,045 and BTC +5.1% at $68.7K extending the post-CPI risk-on rally into its third session. Gold holds above $5,050 (+2.1%) with silver +1.7% at $77 as precious metals shrug off profit-taking. US equities closed Friday's session virtually flat — S&P -0.05%, Nasdaq -0.32%, Dow +0.03% — digesting the week's volatility. VIX crept +2.3% to 21.3 as traders brace for weekend flows; oil drifts lower at $62.50 (-0.5%) on oversupply concerns.

title: Valentine's Morning
commentary: Valentine's rally extends into the weekend as crypto keeps flying — ETH +5.8% at $2,060 and BTC +4.2% at $69K, both best performers for a second straight session. Precious metals maintain momentum with gold +2.2% at $5,057 and silver +2.7% at $77.75 as inflation fears recede. US equities closed Friday's session flat — S&P +0.2%, Dow +0.1%, Nasdaq flat — consolidating last week's CPI relief bounce. Oil and dollar both unchanged; weekend flows favor risk assets.

title: Valentine's Weekend
commentary: Valentine's weekend kicks off with crypto on fire — BTC +5.3% at $69.1K and ETH +7.2% at $2,056 as risk appetite roars back post-CPI relief. Precious metals extend gains with gold +2.1% reclaiming $5,053 and silver +2.5% at $77.60 as Fed cut bets revive on soft inflation print. US equities closed the week green: S&P +0.48%, Nasdaq +0.41%, Dow +0.27%, with VIX collapsing -7.4% to 19.28 signaling calm ahead. Oil the laggard at -0.7% on OPEC+ output hike speculation.

title: Weekend Early Hours
commentary: Risk-on mode returns as crypto stages a Valentine's rally — BTC surges +5.5% back above $69K while ETH rips +7.9% reclaiming $2,050 in the strongest 24-hour move in weeks. VIX collapses -7% to 19.3 signaling the Friday the 13th panic is fading fast. Gold extends its run +1.9% to $5,044 and silver +2.5% to $77.50 as precious metals shrug off profit-taking. US equities closed the week green with Russell 2000 leading +1.9%, S&P +0.6% — a full reversal from Thursday's bloodbath.

title: Asia Early Session
commentary: Crypto surges ahead of Valentine's Day weekend as Bitcoin reclaims $69K territory on fresh institutional inflows. Ethereum outpaces with an 8% rally, leading altcoin recovery. Gold holds firm above $2,900 as safe-haven demand persists amid geopolitical uncertainties. US futures point to a quiet Friday open with markets digesting Thursday's mixed data.

title: Valentine's Day Weekend Open
commentary: Crypto stages a Valentine's Day relief rally — ETH rips +4.4% back above $2,000 and BTC climbs +2.2% to $68.6K as risk appetite returns. Precious metals extend their winning streak with gold +1.7% reclaiming $5,030 and silver +2.4% at $77.50. US equities close the week quietly — S&P 500 +0.23%, Nasdaq +0.08%, Dow +0.15% as volatility subsides with VIX dropping to 20.6 (-1.2%). Defensives lead the tape: Utilities +2%, Basic Materials +1.7%; Asia lags overnight with Nikkei -1.2% and Hang Seng -1.7% on China growth concerns.

title: Friday Late Night SGT
commentary: Markets stabilize after the Friday the 13th bloodbath as CPI delivers a rare positive surprise — January inflation came in at 2.4% YoY vs. 2.9% expected, with core at 2.5%. Gold reclaims $5,000 (+0.96%) and silver snaps back +2.5% to $77.60 as the soft landing narrative gets a second wind. Equities remain in recovery mode with S&P 500 -0.49%, Nasdaq -0.80% trimming earlier losses. VIX holds elevated at 21 as traders digest the whipsaw; oil slides -0.7% to $62.40 on OPEC+ output hike chatter. Bond bulls vindicated — Treasury yields retreating on renewed rate cut hopes.

title: Friday Evening SGT
commentary: VIX explodes 17.6% above 20 as Wall Street's Friday the 13th massacre deepens — S&P 500 dumps 1.6%, Nasdaq sheds 2.0%, Russell 2000 craters 2.0% as the post-CPI selloff accelerates. Silver stages a violent 4.3% snap-back rally to $79 after yesterday's 11% implosion, while gold reclaims $5,000 (+1.2%) in a classic flight-to-safety bid. Crypto offers no shelter — BTC slips 1.1% to $67.3K as digital assets track equities lower. Tech remains the epicenter with INTC -3.7% and NVDA -1.6%; Fastly +72% the lone bright spot on earnings surprise.
